moves.1... g6: The Robatsch or the Pirc Defense.
moves.2. Nc3: The most played move here is 2.d4 as it is more flexible.
moves.2... Bg7 3. d4: Switching back to the main line.  The most aggressive 4th move here for White is f4 which leads to double-edged play.
moves.4. h3: Not a strong move.  The only positive side to this move is protection of d4 as I can't play Bg4 to attack the knight on f3. Yet I wasn't going to play Bg4 anyways as my target will be e4 after I play ...a6, b5, Bb7, Nf6, and possibly b4 all attacking e4.
moves.4... Nf6: Taking advantage of White's passive play, I don't need to worry about the e5 push, and I can continue attacking the e4 pawn.
moves.5. Bg5: The bishop belongs on e3.  White cannot afford to trade the dark squared bishop for the knight because then my bishop would become very powerful.
moves.6. d5: ?! This simply gives me a target to attack.  White does not have enough pieces developed to make pawn moves such as this.
moves.6... c6: Attacking the center.  In line with hypermodern theory, I can't allow White to protect his center or else he will continue to gain space and suffocate me.
moves.7... exf6: Opening the e-file to attack the e4 pawn.  White is lost here.
moves.8. Nf3 Re8: The e4 pawn is doomed.  White's king is stuck in the center.
moves.9. dxc6: ?? Allowing me to develop another piece.  White does not realize that he is lost.
moves.9... Nxc6 10. Bb5: I am not worried about this.
moves.11. Bxc6 bxc6: Strengthening my center.  So I can attack e4.
moves.12. Qd3: ?? White must castle if he is to stay in the game.
moves.12... fxe4 13. Nxe4 Bf5: The pawn is gone, but now the knight is pinned.  Now Black has a sure material advantage.
moves.14. Nfd2 d5: Notice the difference in development between Black and White.
moves.15. O-O-O Rb8: Black does not stop to take his material yet, instead he keeps his initiative.
moves.16. Nb3 Bxe4 17. Qa6 Qf6 18. f3: ??? Mate in 4, Can you find it?
moves.18... Qxb2+ 19. Kd2 Bxc2: The key to the solution.  I have to admit I am very proud to find this move :)  At first I didn't think there was a simple mate, because the King just runs to the other side.  But, the white king is in a mating net, because of the rook on e8.
moves.21... Qc2#: I hope you enjoyed the game, if nothing else then for the mate at the end.  Hopefully when I no longer have a provisional rating, I will get a evenly balanced game or even a good loss that I can analyze for you.
